00048 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00049 
00050 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00051 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00052 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00053 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00054 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00055 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00056 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00057 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00058 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00059 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00061 typedef struct {
00062 
00063     volatile unsigned long lock;
00064 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00065     const char *file;
00066     const char *function;
00067     unsigned line;
00068     int cpu;
00069 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00070 } xnlock_t;
00071 
00072 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00073 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00074 #else
00075 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00076         0,                                      \
00077         NULL,                                   \
00078         0,                                      \
00079         -1                                      \
00080         }
00081 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00082 
00083 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00084 
00085 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00086 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00087 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00088 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00089     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00090 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00100 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00101 
00102 static inline spl_t
00103 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00104 {
00105     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00106 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00107 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00108 {
00109 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00110     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00111     unsigned long flags;
00112 
00113     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00114 
00115     adeos_load_cpuid();
00116 
00117     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00118         {
00119         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00120             /* Use an non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00121                bit_spin_lock. */
00122             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00123                 {
00124                 cpu_relax();
00125 
00126 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00127                 if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00128                     {
00129                     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00130                     printk(KERN_ERR
00131                            "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00132                            "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00133                            "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00134                            lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00135                            lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00136                     show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00137                     for (;;)
00138                         safe_halt();
00139                     }
00140 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00141                 }
00142 
00143 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00144         lock->file = file;
00145         lock->function = function;
00146         lock->line = line;
00147         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00148 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00149         }
00150     else
00151         flags |= 2;
00152 
00153     return flags;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00157 
00158 {
00159     if (!(flags & 2))
00160         {
00161         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00162 
00163         rthal_cli();
00164 
00165         adeos_load_cpuid();
00166 
00167         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00168             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00169         }
00170 
00171     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00172 }
00173 
00174 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00175 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00176 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00177 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00178 
00179 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00180 
00181 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00182 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00183 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00184 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00185 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00186 
00187 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00189 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00190 
00191 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00192 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00193 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00194    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00195    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but uses a dedicated
00196    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00197 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00198 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00199 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00200 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00249 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00250 
00251     /* Kernel mode side */
00252     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00253     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00254     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00255     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00256     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00257 
00258     /* User mode side */
00259     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00260     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00261 
00262     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00263     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00264     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00265 
00266 } xnarchtcb_t;
00267

00294 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00295     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00296 }
00297 
00298 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00299     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00300 }
00301 
00302 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00303     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00304 }
00305 
00306 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00307     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00308 }

00310 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00311     return adeos_processor_id();
00312 }
00313 
00314 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00315 
00316 {
00317     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00318         return vmalloc(bytes);
00319 
00320     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00321 }
00322 
00323 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00324 
00325 {
00326     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00327         vfree(chunk);
00328     else
00329         kfree(chunk);
00330 }
00331 
00332 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00333 {
00334     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00335 }

00341 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00342 do { \
00343     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00344     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00345     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00346     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00347 } while(0)

00352 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00353 
00354 {
00355     spl_t s;
00356     splhigh(s);
00357     splexit(!!imask);
00358     return !!s;
00359 }

00420 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00421 
00422 {
00423     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00424 
00425     adeos_load_cpuid();
00426 
00427     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00428        and always inside a critical section. */
00429     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00430     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00431     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00432     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00433     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00434 }
00435 
00436 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00437 {
00438     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00439 }
00440 
00441 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00442                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00443                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00444                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00445                                     )
00446 {
00447 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00448 
00449     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00450         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00451         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00452         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00453         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00454         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00455         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00456         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00457         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00458         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00459         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00460         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00461         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00462         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00463         "ret\n\t" \
00464 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00465         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00466         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00467       : /* no output */ \
00468       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00469         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00470         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00471         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00472         "b" (out_tcb), \
00473         "S" (in_tcb), \
00474         "a" (outproc), \
00475         "d" (inproc));
00476 
00477 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00478 
00479     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00480     
00481     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00482         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00483         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00484         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00485         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00486         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00487         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00488         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00489         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00490         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00491         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00492         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00493         "ret\n\t" \
00494 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00495       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00496         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00497         "=S" (esi_out), \
00498         "=D" (edi_out), \
00499         "+a" (outproc), \
00500         "+d" (inproc) \
00501       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00502         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00503         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00504         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00505 
00506 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00507 }
00508 
00509 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00510                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00511 {
00512     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00513     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00514 
00515     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00516         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00517            clear the ts bit. */
00518         clts();
00519     
00520     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00521 
00522     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00523         {
00524         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00525 
00526         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00527 
00528         if (!inproc->mm)
00529             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00530         }
00531 
00532     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00533 
00534     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00535 
00536         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00537            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00538            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00539            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00540            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00541            raw I/O ops. */
00542 
00543         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00544 
00545         barrier();
00546 
00547         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00548             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, adeos_processor_id());
00549 
00550             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00551                 
00552                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00553 
00554                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00555                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00556                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00557                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00558 
00559                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00560                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00561             }
00562         }
00563     }
00564 
00565     stts();
00566 }
00567 
00568 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00569                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00570 {
00571     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00572 }
00573 
00574 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00575 {
00576     /* Empty */
00577 }
00578 
00579 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00580                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00581                                          const char *name)
00582 {
00583     tcb->user_task = current;
00584     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00585     tcb->esp = 0;
00586     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00587     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00588     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00589 }
00590 
00591 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00592                                                int imask,
00593                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00594                                                void *cookie)
00595 {
00596     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00597     stts();
00598     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00599     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00600     entry(cookie);
00601     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00602 }
00603 
00604 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00605                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00606                                        void *cookie,
00607                                        int imask,
00608                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00609                                        char *name)
00610 {
00611     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00612 
00613     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00614     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00615     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00616     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00617     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00618     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00619     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00620     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00621     *--(*psp) = 0;
00622 }
00623 
00624 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00625 
00626 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00627 
00628 {
00629     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00630        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00631 
00632     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00633 
00634     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00635         {
00636         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00637         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00638         }
00639 }
00640 
00641 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00642 
00643 {
00644     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00645     
00646     if(task)
00647         {
00648         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00649             return;
00650 
00651         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00652            of this task. */
00653         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00654         }
00655 
00656     clts();
00657     
00658     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00659         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00660     else
00661         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00662 }
00663 
00664 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00665 
00666 {
00667     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00668 
00669     if (task)
00670         {
00671 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00672         if (!tsk_used_math(task))
00673 #else
00674         if (!task->used_math)
00675 #endif
00676             {
00677             stts();
00678             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00679             }
00680 
00681         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00682            hardware. */
00683         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00684         }
00685 
00686     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00687        user-space or kernel thread. */
00688     clts();
00689 
00690     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00691         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00692     else
00693         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00694 }
00695 
00696 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00697 
00698 {
00699     clts();
00700 
00701     if(!cpu_has_fxsr && tcb->user_task)
00702     /* fnsave also initializes the FPU state, so that on cpus prior to PII
00703        (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved state. */
00704         xnarch_restore_fpu(tcb);
00705 }
00706 
00707 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00708 
00709 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00710 
00711 {}
00712 
00713 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00714 
00715 {}
00716 
00717 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00718 
00719 {}
00720 
00721 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00722 
00723 {}
00724 
00725 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00726 
00727 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP

00729 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00730 
00731     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00732 }
00733 
00734 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00735 
00736 {
00737     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00738                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00739                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00740                                      NULL,
00741                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00742 }
00743 
00744 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00745 
00746 {
00747     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00748                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00749                                      NULL,
00750                                      NULL,
00751                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00752 }
00753 
00754 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00755 
00756 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00757 {
00758     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00759 }
00760 
00761 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00762     
00763 {
00764     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00765     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00766     unsigned long flags;
00767     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00768 
00769     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00770 
00771     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00772        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00773        context. */
00774     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00775                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00776 
00777     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00778     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00779     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00780     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00781 
00782     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00783         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00784     
00785     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00786                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00787 }
00788 
00789 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00790 
00791 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00792 
00793     return 0;
00794 }
00795 
00796 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00797 
00798     return 0;
00799 }
00800 
00801 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00802 
00803     return 0;
00804 }
00805 
00806 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00807 
00808 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00809 
00810 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00811 
00812 {
00813 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00814     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00815        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00816     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00817 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00818 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00819     xnshadow_release_events();
00820 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00821     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00822     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00823     schedule_timeout(50);
00824     xnarch_release_ipi();
00825 }
00826 
00827 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00828 
00829 {
00830     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00831 
00832     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00833         {
00834         spl_t s;
00835         splsync(s);
00836         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00837         splexit(s);
00838         return 1;
00839         }
00840 
00841     return 0;
00842 }
00843 
00844 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00845 
00846 {
00847 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00848     xnshadow_grab_events();
00849 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00850 }

00852 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00857 {
00858     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00859     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00860     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00861     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00862     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00863     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00864 }

00868 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE

00870 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00871                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00872                                            const char *name)
00873 {
00874     struct task_struct *task = current;
00875 
00876     tcb->user_task = task;
00877     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00878     tcb->esp = 0;
00879     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00880     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00881     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00882 }
00883 
00884 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00885 
00886 {
00887     unsigned irq;
00888 
00889     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00890         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00891                              handler,
00892                              NULL,
00893                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00894 }
00895 
00896 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00897 
00898 {
00899     unsigned irq;
00900 
00901     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00902         {
00903         switch (irq)
00904             {
00905 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00906             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00907             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00908             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00909             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00910 
00911                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00912                 continue;
00913 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00914 
00915             default:
00916 
00917                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00918             }
00919         }
00920 }
00921 
00922 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00923 
00924 {
00925     unsigned irq;
00926 
00927     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00928         {
00929         switch (irq)
00930             {
00931 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00932             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00933             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00934             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00935             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00936 
00937                 continue;
00938 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00939 
00940             default:
00941 
00942                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00943             }
00944         }
00945 }
00946 
00947 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00949 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00950 
00951 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00952     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00953        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough for
00954        now. If a timer need more, a spurious but harmless call to the tick
00955        handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00956     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00957 }
00958 
00959 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00960     rthal_release_timer();
00961 }
00962 
00963 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00964 
00965 {
00966 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00967     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00968 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00969     return 0;
00970 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00971 }
00972 
00973 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00974                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00975                                         unsigned long long defval)
00976 {
00977 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00978     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00979     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00980     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00981 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00982     *shot = defval;
00983     *delivery = defval;
00984 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00985 }
00986 
00987 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00999 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
01000                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
01001                                           unsigned long paddr,
01002                                           unsigned long size,
01003                                           pgprot_t prot)
01004 {
01005 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,10)
01006     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
01007 #else /* Linux version < 2.6.10 */
01008     return remap_page_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr,size,prot);
01009 #endif /* Linux version >= 2.6.10 */
01010 }

01012 #endif /* XENO_HEAP_MODULE */
01013 
01014 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
01015 
01016 #include <linux/init.h>
01017 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
01018 
01019 extern u_long nkschedlat;
01020 
01021 extern u_long nktimerlat;
01022 
01023 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
01024 
01025 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
01026 
01027 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
01028 
01029 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
01030 
01031 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
01032 {
01033     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
01034 
01035     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
01036     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
01037     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
01038 
01039     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
01040 }
01041 
01042 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
01043 
01044 {
01045 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
01046     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
01047 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
01048     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
01049        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
01050        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
01051        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
01052        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
01053        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
01054     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer()) ?: 1;
01055 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
01056 }
01057 
01058 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
01059 
01060 {
01061     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
01062 
01063     if (!nktimerlat)
01064         return -ENODEV;
01065 
01066     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
01067 
01068     return 0;
01069 }
01070 
01071 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
01072 
01073 {
01074     int err;
01075 
01076 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
01077     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
01078        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
01079     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
01080 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
01081 
01082     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
01083 
01084     if (err)
01085         return err;
01086 
01087     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
01088 
01089     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
01090         return -ENOSYS;
01091 
01092     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
01093                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
01094                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
01095                               NULL,
01096                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
01097 
01098     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
01099 
01100 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01101     err = xnshadow_mount();
01102 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01103 
01104     if (err)
01105         {
01106         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01107         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01108         }
01109 
01110     return err;
01111 }
01112 
01113 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
01114 
01115 {
01116 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01117     xnshadow_cleanup();
01118 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01119     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01120     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01121 }
01122 
01123 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
01124 
01125 #ifdef __cplusplus
01126 }
01127 #endif
